intro: Glochidion sambiranense var. trapezophyllum, commonly known as the trapezoidal glochidion, is a shrub native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are often elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellowish-green in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native range.
